news_header: Thames Water has secured a £3bn rescue loan from the High Court, avoiding government control as it restructures amid £19bn debt. The company, which serves a quarter of the UK population, has faced criticism for its performance and sewage issues.
news_original_title: Thames Water secures £3bn lifeline after court ruling
news_text: While the loan provides temporary relief, the future remains uncertain as it seeks to appeal for higher household bills to support necessary investments.
